title: لَا سِيَّمَا
description: Learn about the expression لَا سِيَّمَا (especially, particularly) - its components, grammatical analysis, and the different cases of the noun following it.

notes.title: What is لا سيّما?
content: لَا سِيَّمَا is a compound expression meaning 'especially' or 'particularly.' It's used to single out one item from a group as being more deserving of what was mentioned.
It consists of three parts: لَا (negation), سِيّ (equal/like - from سَوَاء), and مَا. The word سِيّ is originally مُضَاف (possessed), and what follows is مُضَاف إِلَيْهِ.
keyPoints: Singles out special item from group

examples.english: I respect scholars, especially the truthful ones

notes.title: Components Analysis
content: لَا: نَافِيَة لِلْجِنْس (negates the genus), making the whole phrase mean 'there is nothing equal to X.' سِيّ: اسْم لَا النَّافِيَة لِلْجِنْس, meaning 'equal/like.'
مَا: Has multiple possible analyses - it can be مَوْصُولَة (relative), زَائِدَة (extra), or نَكِرَة مَوْصُوفَة (indefinite described). Each affects the case of the following noun.
keyPoints: سِيّ = اسم لا مبني على الفتح

notes.title: Case of Following Noun: رَفْع
content: The noun after لَا سِيَّمَا can be مَرْفُوع (nominative) when مَا is analyzed as مَوْصُولَة (relative pronoun) and the noun is the مُبْتَدَأ of a deleted predicate.
Analysis: لَا سِيَّمَا الَّذِي هُوَ التُّفَّاحُ → لَا سِيَّمَا التُّفَّاحُ (with التفاحُ as مبتدأ لخبر محذوف هُوَ).

examples.arabic: أَقْرَأُ الْكُتُبَ وَلَا سِيَّمَا كُتُبُ النَّحْوِ

notes.title: Case of Following Noun: جَرّ
content: The noun can be مَجْرُور (genitive) when مَا is analyzed as زَائِدَة (extra/emphatic), and the noun is مُضَاف إِلَيْهِ to سِيّ.
Analysis: سِيّ is مُضَاف, and the following noun is مُضَاف إِلَيْهِ مَجْرُور. This is a common and straightforward analysis.

examples.arabic: يَنْفَعُ الْعِلْمُ وَلَا سِيَّمَا عِلْمِ الدِّينِ

notes.title: Case of Following Noun: نَصْب
content: The noun can be مَنْصُوب (accusative) when مَا is analyzed as نَكِرَة مَوْصُوفَة (indefinite noun that is described), and the noun is تَمْيِيز or بَدَل.
This is less common but grammatically valid. Some grammarians also allow نَصْب by treating the noun as مُسْتَثْنَى.

examples.arabic: يُسْعِدُنِي الْكَرَمُ وَلَا سِيَّمَا كَرَمَ الْعَرَبِ

notes.title: Usage Notes
content: All three cases (رَفْع، جَرّ، نَصْب) are grammatically valid. رَفْع and جَرّ are more common. The meaning remains the same regardless of case.
لَا سِيَّمَا is always preceded by a general statement and followed by a specific item that deserves special attention from that general category.

examples.arabic: اقْرَأِ الْقُرْآنَ وَلَا سِيَّمَا سُورَةُ يس
examples.english: Read the Quran, especially Surah Yasin
Your words pleased me, especially your advice

examples.arabic: يَجِبُ احْتِرَامُ الْكِبَارِ وَلَا سِيَّمَا الْوَالِدَيْنِ
examples.english: Elders must be respected, especially parents

examples.arabic: الصِّدْقُ مَحْمُودٌ وَلَا سِيَّمَا عِنْدَ الشِّدَّةِ
examples.english: Honesty is praiseworthy, especially in hardship

exercises.prompt: إِذَا كَانَتْ مَا مَوْصُولَةً، فَالاسْمُ بَعْدَهَا _____
exercises.promptEn: If ما is relative, the noun after it is _____

exercises.prompt: إِذَا كَانَتْ مَا زَائِدَةً، فَالاسْمُ بَعْدَهَا _____
exercises.promptEn: If ما is extra, the noun after it is _____

exercises.prompt: لَا فِي لَا سِيَّمَا هِيَ لَا النَّافِيَةُ لِـ_____
exercises.promptEn: لا in لا سيّما is لا that negates _____

exercises.prompt: أُحِبُّ الْعُلُومَ وَلَا سِيَّمَا _____ (النحوُ/النحوِ/النحوَ - all valid)
exercises.promptEn: I love sciences, especially grammar (any case valid)

exercises.answer: لا that negates the entire genus/category
